newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK RATES UP ON BOND AUCTION FUNDING.
newsitem.headline: GREEK RATES UP ON BOND AUCTION FUNDING.

text.p: Greek depos and forex forwards were trading higher in early dealings as players sought funding for the auction of five-, seven-and 10-year bonds on July 15, dealers said.
Yields of five-, seven- and 10-year bonds were up five to 10 ticks after coming under selling pressure from local banks. Ecu/drachma was hovering around 309.51/56 after hitting a high of 309.63/68.

"Depos are up a fifth of a point from one-week on and forex forwards have risen about 30 basis points from one-month on as players seek funding for the auction of bonds on July 15," a dealer at a private bank said.

Greece will seek bids for a further 75 billion drachmas each of five- and seven-year bonds with coupons of 9.2 percent and 8.9 percent respectively, and 120 billion drachmas of 8.8 percent, 10-year bonds on July 15, the finance ministry announced late on Thursday.
The five- and seven-year bonds were auctioned for the first time ever on March 19 and then bids were re-opened on June 17. The 10-year bonds were auctioned for the first time ever on June 17.
Greece will also auction 150 billion drachmas of seven-year floating rate notes on July 29.

"Local banks have been selling five-, seven- and 10-year bonds this morning, driving their yields up five to 10 basis points," a bond dealer said. "The size of the auction, especially for 10-year bonds is large and the high cost of carry makes them unattractive."
The dealer said he expected little interest from foreign investors for the 10-year bond given a negative cost of carry of more than 200 basis points.
"An investor could buy into a 10-year bond if the cost of carry is about 50 basis points and the yield curve inverted but not when the cost of carry is more than 200 basis points," a dealer said.
The mark was quoted at 157.38/48 from Thursday's 157.480 fix, the dollar at 276.15/25 drachmas from 276.280 and the ecu at 309.69/79 from 309.55 drachmas.
"Ecu/drachma is trading in familiar ranges, currently around 309.51/56 after going up to 309.63/68," said a forex dealer at foreign bank. "Trading activity is calm and moderate."
